name: rust-panic-highlighter
description: Highlights lines in Rust code that can panic

scripts.compile: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js
scripts.package: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js --production
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint

rustPanicHighlighter.diagnostic.severity.description: Set the severity level for Rust panic diagnostics.

rustPanicHighlighter.diagnostic.ignoreIn.description: Whether to ignore Rust panic diagnostics within test blocks.

rustPanicHighlighter.diagnostic.ignoredP.description: List of panic types to ignore for diagnostics. Leave empty to enable all.

rustPanicHighlighter.icon.enabled.description: Enable or disable the icon display at the end of the line.

rustPanicHighlighter.icon.path.description: Specify the path to the icon to display at the end of the line. You can specify a file path ending with .gif, .png, .jpg, .jpeg, or .svg, or a directory path that ends with a '/'. If a directory is specified, a random image from the directory will be chosen. It is recommended to use an SVG file. Use 'default' to load the extension's default icon.
rustPanicHighlighter.icon.path.patternErrorMessage: The value must be 'default' or a path ending with .gif, .png, .jpg, .jpeg, .svg, or a directory ending with '/'.

rustPanicHighlighter.icon.minXPositionEn.description: Enable or disable the minimum X position for the icon. When disabled (false), the icon will be positioned just after the line's content. When enabled (true), the icon will have a minimum position of 100 characters from the start of the line.

rustPanicHighlighter.icon.size.description: Specify the size of the icon in pixels. This setting defines both the width and height, ensuring a square bounding box. In the case of an SVG, ensure that it does not have a default width or height set, as this may override the configured size. For non-square images, the aspect ratio will still be preserved within the bounding box.

rustPanicHighlighter.icon.adjustTopPosit.description: Adjust the top position of the icon in pixels. Use a positive or negative number to fine-tune the vertical alignment. This setting compensates for potential alignment issues caused by differences in editor configurations (such as font size, line height, etc.). Depending on the user's setup, icons might appear slightly misaligned, and this option allows you to manually adjust their vertical position to achieve the best visual result.
